summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Burundi and the Great Lakes region, particularly resolution 1650 (2005),
Reaffirms its commitment to Burundi's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity,
Congratulates the people of Burundi on the successful conclusion of the transitional period and peaceful transfer of authority,
Takes note of the Secretary-General's letter (S/2006/206),
Recalling that ONUB and MONUC mandates expire on 1 July 2006 and 30 September 2006 respectively,
Noting remaining instability factors in Burundi and the region,
Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,
1. Authorizes the Secretary-General to temporarily redeploy up to one infantry battalion, a military hospital, and 50 military observers from ONUB to MONUC until 1 July 2006, with intention to renew;
2. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
